TopicTitle: MULTIPLAYER? developers please read this i'm sure your gonna like it !!!!

Articles.Content:
ok guys wait finish reading this before you start ****ing about it but of course after you finish the missions and resources thing

so i have this idea that would be really great for co-op so lets begin!!!!!

1_you join your friends max is 3 players

2_you have your own save game with your 2 friends

3_this is how you play the game....so there is 3 bases for every player and one big base for the 3 players

4_you only can build satellites with your own base and you have you own resources,money and kerbals

5_when you wanna build a space ship all three players have to go to the bigbase and share the money,resources and kerbals

6_the 3 players have there same screen and they have to build one ship for the 3 players(you can build more then one ship but there all for the 3 players)

7_when building the ship ever player has to put one kerbal into the ship

8_after building it and ready to lunch players will decide what to control with the ship

9_one player takes control on the map screen and with the rocket science(only one player can see the map and do rocket science)

10_one player takes control on the thrust and on the R,T buttons which i don't remember the names and on the legs brakes lights everything that is attached to the ship

11_one player takes control on the ball

12_and sometimes the players have to face asteroid which i hope that it will exist in the game

Regardless of how it is worded, this is still a multiplayer suggestion not all that different from other suggestions regarding co-op and multiplayer gameplay.

If multiplayer in any form is ever implemented, it will be done first as a game mod. Already you can use Telemachus to provide a co-op capability of mission control / crew, while actual SMP multiplayer has long been theorized and has page upon page of implementation notes on hand and in several reference threads in the addon development section.

Please refer to http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/36863-What-not-to-suggest for a list of ideas that probably have already been suggested or are known to not be planned for implementation.
